title: Abide: Composable Poetic Form Verification Framework
description: Root epic for the Abide framework - a composable constraint algebra for specifying and auto-verifying poetic forms. Goal: produce abide-major-poetic-forms eval from composed primitives compatible with verifiers framework. Must be thoroughly tested with input variety handling.

title: Project Setup & Infrastructure
description: Python package structure, dependencies, CI/CD, testing infrastructure. Foundation for all subsequent work.

title: Create pyproject.toml with dependencies
description: Setup Python package: name=abide, Python 3.10+. Core deps: pronouncing, cmudict, nltk, numpy. Dev deps: pytest, pytest-cov, hypothesis (fuzz testing), mypy, ruff. Optional: torch for small NNs.

title: Create package directory structure
description: Create: abide/ (main package), abide/primitives/ (NLP tools), abide/constraints/ (constraint types), abide/forms/ (form templates), abide/integration/ (verifiers adapter), tests/ with mirrors.

title: Setup pytest with hypothesis for property testing
description: Configure pytest.ini/pyproject.toml for pytest. Add hypothesis for property-based testing. Create conftest.py with common fixtures. Ensure tests can generate random poem-like inputs.

title: Add pre-commit hooks (ruff, mypy)
description: Setup .pre-commit-config.yaml with ruff (linting/formatting) and mypy (type checking). Ensure strict type checking for core modules.

title: Create GitHub Actions CI workflow
description: CI workflow: test on Python 3.10, 3.11, 3.12. Run pytest with coverage. Run ruff and mypy. Cache dependencies. Run on PR and push to main.

title: Form Templates Library
description: Pre-composed forms: sestina, villanelle, sonnet variants, haiku, tanka, ghazal, pantoum, blues poem, free verse. Each form built entirely from primitives.

title: Sestina form template
description: Compose from primitives: 7 stanzas, sizes [6,6,6,6,6,6,3], end-word rotation, envoi pattern. All from primitive constraints. Include comprehensive tests with real sestinas.

title: Villanelle form template
description: Compose: 19 lines, 6 stanzas [3,3,3,3,3,4], ABA rhyme scheme, A1/A2 refrains at specified positions. Test with Dylan Thomas 'Do not go gentle'.

title: Sonnet variants (Shakespearean, Petrarchan, Spenserian)
description: 14 lines, 10 syllables/line (iambic pentameter). Shakespearean: ABABCDCDEFEFGG. Petrarchan: ABBAABBA + CDECDE/CDCDCD. Spenserian: ABABBCBCCDCDEE. Each as composed form.

title: Haiku and Tanka templates
description: Haiku: 3 lines, 5-7-5 syllables, no title, no rhyme. Tanka: 5 lines, 5-7-5-7-7 syllables. Test syllable counting edge cases thoroughly.

title: Additional forms: ghazal, pantoum, blues poem, limerick
description: Ghazal: couplets with radif/qafia. Pantoum: interlocking quatrains. Blues: AAB pattern. Limerick: AABBA with anapestic meter. Each composed from primitives.

title: Verifiers Framework Integration
description: Adapter layer for verifiers framework compatibility. RewardEnvironment interface, batch evaluation, proper reward scaling. Target: abide-major-poetic-forms eval.

title: Create verifiers-compatible reward function interface
description: Implement interface matching verifiers framework expectations. Input: text output. Output: float reward in [0,1]. Support batch evaluation. Include metadata (rubric, component scores).

title: Build abide-major-poetic-forms eval
description: THE GOAL: Compose all form templates into single eval. Include: sestina, villanelle, sonnets, haiku, tanka, ghazal, pantoum. Each form as separate eval task. Export in verifiers-compatible format.

title: Create example eval run with sample poems
description: Demonstrate full pipeline: load form, evaluate real poems (good and bad examples), show rewards and rubrics. Include in examples/ directory. Document expected outputs.

title: Write integration documentation
description: Document how to use abide with verifiers framework and ART RL. Include: installation, basic usage, custom form creation, extending with new constraints. README and docs/.

title: Core NLP Primitives
description: Foundational NLP tools: phonetic encoders, similarity metrics, rhyme detection, syllable counting, stress detection. Use CMU dict, pronouncing lib, small NNs where appropriate. Every primitive thoroughly tested.

title: Implement string similarity functions
description: Levenshtein distance, normalized Levenshtein, Jaro similarity, Jaro-Winkler. All with comprehensive tests including edge cases (empty strings, Unicode, very long strings).

title: Implement phonetic encoders
description: Soundex, Double Metaphone, NYSIIS. Wrap existing libraries where available (jellyfish, fuzzy). Test against known encoding tables. Handle non-ASCII gracefully.

title: Integrate CMU Pronouncing Dictionary
description: Use 'pronouncing' library for CMU dict access. Create wrapper with: get_phonemes(word), get_rhyme_part(word), words_rhyme(w1, w2, strictness). Cache lookups. Handle unknown words gracefully.

title: Implement syllable counter
description: Primary: CMU dict phoneme counting. Fallback: rule-based syllable estimation for unknown words. Test against known syllable counts. Consider pyphen for hyphenation-based approach.

title: Implement stress pattern detector
description: Extract stress patterns from CMU phonemes (0=no stress, 1=primary, 2=secondary). Detect common meters: iambic, trochaic, dactylic, anapestic, spondaic. For unknown words: consider small NN or heuristics.

title: Implement rhyme classifier
description: Classify rhymes: perfect, near/slant, eye rhyme, assonance, consonance. Use phoneme analysis + orthographic checks. Return rhyme type and confidence score. Test with known rhyme pairs.

title: Create combined word similarity scorer
description: Weighted combination of: exact match, edit distance, Jaro-Winkler, phonetic similarity. Configurable weights. Return score in [0,1] with breakdown. Used by all fuzzy matching constraints.

title: Text Preprocessing & Parsing
description: Robust text normalization, line/stanza extraction, word tokenization. Must handle whitespace variety (tabs, CRLF, multiple blanks), punctuation edge cases, Unicode. Extensive fuzz testing.

title: Implement whitespace normalizer
description: Handle: CRLF/LF/CR line endings, tabs to spaces, multiple consecutive blank lines, trailing whitespace. Configurable strictness. Return normalized text + quality score. Fuzz test with hypothesis.

title: Implement line and stanza parser
description: Split text into lines and stanzas. Stanza boundary = blank line(s). Return PoemStructure dataclass with: lines, stanzas, line_count, stanza_count, stanza_sizes. Handle edge cases: empty input, no stanza breaks, trailing blanks.

title: Implement word tokenizer with punctuation handling
description: Extract words from lines. Handle: contractions (don't, it's), hyphenated words, em-dashes, ellipses, quotation marks, Unicode punctuation. Preserve or strip punctuation (configurable). Test extensively.

title: Implement end-word extractor
description: Extract final word from each line for rhyme/pattern analysis. Strip trailing punctuation intelligently. Handle: lines ending in quotes, parentheses, multiple punctuation. Normalize to lowercase.

title: Create hypothesis strategies for poem generation
description: Hypothesis strategies to generate: random lines, stanzas, full poems with various whitespace patterns. Use for fuzz testing all preprocessing functions. Include edge cases: empty, very long, Unicode, mixed encodings.

title: Constraint Type System
description: Core constraint algebra: base types, numeric bounds, verification results, rubric generation. Invertible constraints that can describe what they check. Foundation for all constraint implementations.

title: Define core type enums and dataclasses
description: Create: ConstraintType enum (structural, relational, prosodic, sonic), BoundType enum (exact, min, max, range), VerificationResult dataclass (score, passed, rubric_items), NumericBound class with validation.

title: Implement abstract Constraint base class
description: Abstract base: verify(poem) -> VerificationResult, describe() -> str (human readable), to_rubric() -> RubricItem. All constraints inherit from this. Include weight attribute for composition.

title: Implement RubricItem and auto-rubric generation
description: RubricItem: criterion description, expected value, actual value, score, explanation. Constraints auto-generate rubric items explaining what was checked and why it passed/failed. Human-readable output.

title: Implement spectrum reward calculation
description: Convert constraint verification to [0,1] scores. Support: binary (pass/fail), linear interpolation, Gaussian decay for numeric constraints. Configurable strictness curves. Include uncertainty estimation.

title: Create constraint serialization (to/from dict)
description: All constraints serializable to dict/JSON for storage and composition. Include constraint type, parameters, weight. Support reconstruction from serialized form. Enables saving/loading form definitions.

title: Structural Constraints
description: Line count, stanza count, stanza sizes, word count, character limits. All constraints composable and produce spectrum rewards with clear rubrics.

title: LineCount constraint
description: Verify poem has exact/min/max number of lines. NumericBound support. Gaussian decay reward for near-misses. Clear rubric: 'Expected 14 lines, found 12'.

title: StanzaCount constraint
description: Verify poem has exact/min/max stanzas. Works with PoemStructure. Rubric shows actual vs expected.

title: StanzaSizes constraint
description: Verify each stanza has specified line count. Support patterns like [6,6,6,6,6,6,3] for sestina or [3,3,3,3,3,4] for villanelle. Partial credit for partial match.

title: SyllablesPerLine constraint
description: Verify lines have specified syllable counts. Use syllable counter from NLP primitives. Support exact or range. Critical for haiku (5-7-5), iambic pentameter (10), etc.

title: Relational Constraints
description: Rhyme schemes, end-word patterns (sestina rotation), refrain repetition, acrostics. Use phonetic primitives for fuzzy matching. Handle near-rhymes, slant rhymes.

title: RhymeScheme constraint
description: Verify end-rhyme patterns like ABAB, ABBA, ABABCDCDEFEFGG. Use rhyme classifier for perfect/slant detection. Configurable strictness. Support custom rhyme notation.

title: EndWordRotation constraint (Sestina)
description: Verify sestina end-word rotation pattern: retrogradatio cruciata. Extract 6 canonical words from stanza 1, verify rotation through stanzas 2-6. Fuzzy match with configurable threshold.

title: Refrain constraint (Villanelle)
description: Verify repeated lines appear at specified positions. For villanelle: A1 at lines 1,6,12,18 and A2 at lines 3,9,15,19. Fuzzy matching with edit distance for minor variations.

title: Acrostic constraint
description: Verify first letters of lines spell a word/phrase. Support: standard acrostic, mesostich (middle), telestich (end). Case-insensitive matching. Report which letters matched/missed.

title: Prosodic Constraints
description: Meter detection, syllable counting, stress patterns (iambic, trochaic, etc.), caesura. May use small NNs for stress prediction on unknown words.

title: Sonic Texture Constraints
description: Assonance, consonance, alliteration, sibilance, internal rhyme. Phoneme-level analysis for sound patterns beyond end-rhyme.

title: Composition Operators
description: AND, OR, NOT, AtLeast, AtMost, WeightedSum, Sequence. Logical algebra for combining constraints. Proper reward aggregation and rubric composition.

title: AND composition operator
description: Compose multiple constraints with AND logic. All must pass for overall pass. Aggregate reward: product, min, or weighted mean. Compose rubrics from all children.

title: OR composition operator
description: Compose constraints with OR logic. At least one must pass. Aggregate reward: max of children. Rubric shows which constraint(s) passed.

title: NOT operator (constraint negation)
description: Negate a constraint: passes when child fails. Reward = 1 - child_reward. Use case: 'must NOT contain profanity', 'must NOT exceed 100 words'.

title: WeightedSum operator
description: Combine constraints with configurable weights. reward = sum(weight_i * score_i) / sum(weight_i). Primary composition method for form templates. Weights can be learned.

title: AtLeast/AtMost operators
description: AtLeast(n, constraints): at least n must pass. AtMost(n, constraints): no more than n can pass. Useful for flexible form definitions.

title: Epic: Comprehensive Form Verification Enhancement
description:
## Overview
Systematically enhance programmatic verification for ALL poetic forms in abide. Currently many forms only verify structural aspects (line count, stanza count) but not the semantic constraints that define the form.

## Problem Statement
Forms like Tritina, Quatina, Quintina describe end-word rotation patterns but only verify structure. The GRPO training rewards poems that match line counts but NOT the defining characteristics of each form.

## Scope
- 141 forms across 39 form files
- O(1) or O(log N) NLP algorithms only - no neural network verification
- Use existing constraint primitives where possible
- Create new constraint types as needed
- Cascade improvements across similar forms

## Categories of Enhancement
1. End-word rotation forms (Tritina, Quatina, Quintina)
2. Refrain/repetition verification
3. Rhyme scheme enforcement
4. Syllable/meter patterns
5. Acrostic and positional constraints
6. Novel form-specific constraints

## Success Criteria
- All verifiable poetic constraints are programmatically tested
- Training rewards accurately reflect form adherence
- Partial credit scoring for near-misses
